reviews.review: This is the first superhero film that I genuinely enjoyed. It took all the character development from other films but I think they chose the best characters to be in this film and left out the right ones as well to make it a great cinematic experience!
It's amazing movie. .. I love it... Thank you so much Marvel
a good movie with a bunch of action but a lot of plot holes
Pretty decent movie for all the characters on screen.  I'd see it again.  The only disappointing thing will be the cop out in the next movie were they bring most of the characters back.

The action crowds everything else out: the chemistry among characters is lacking. We have all these great characters we’ve “known” for years, could have been so much more. Maybe if the movie went a full three hours it wouldn’t have felt so rushed. Quite disappointed.

This film is up there with Logan as the greatest achievement within the MCU.  Oh man did this film grip me.  Being a diehard fan of the MCU since its infancy I have been gripped every-time a new film has came out.   Marvel has  constructed a universe that make us care about the characters and what is happening...oh yea and they made amazing films along the way with Iron man 2 (3.5 stars out of 5) as their weak point in my personal opinion.  They made us care about these characters and it all resonated and boiled into an exhilarating climax with this film.
Let us get this out of the way.  They knocked it out of the park with this villain. They have been teasing Thanos for YEARS, and its truly a his movie, with our heroes baring the supporting role. It had to be a home run and not a single because they had  built him up as a monster figure who would wreck havoc on the galaxy.  Boy did he do all that. 
 My rare perfect rating would not be possible for the casual MCU fan.  You have more than likely have had to see most of the presiding films to get the full emotional grip.
 I  also thought it all circled around fantastically.  Every character was given their fair screen time and they executed if flawlessly.  I truly thought this balance was key for the film.  This film also packed such a huge emotion punch.  I was driven to tears not because scenes were sad, but because the energy WAS THAT STRONG.  That is film making at its finest.  
I guess I can understand criticism of the film for those who aren't really MCU fans, or haven't been that invested in previous films.  I however was so emotionally rocked that I have been thinking about this film for days (the first iron man, the first avengers, and logan are the only marvel movies to truly do this to me) 
They topped the story off in grand fashion and have me wanting much more. Let me also say another thing.  The humor is so great.  I mean my god it had me rolling but not to the point where I diverted from the soul of the film.  That is where Marvel cannot be touched...The balance of humor humor and story.  They make you care about these people, you build relationships with these characters.  These movies have changed my life and this last film was nothing short of exceptional. I hate we have to wait a year for part 2, but there are some films to hold us over and much to talk about.  Clocking in at a swift 152 minutes, its over in the blink of an eye.  It's cliche to say "it didn't feel that long," but this film really didn't feel that long!! It zoomed by as each scene had an enormous amount to offer. 
Exceptional film making.

This is what a comic book hero movie should do - what it is capable of.  The creators of this movie, like the creators of "Logan", or Frank Miller with the Dark Knight, or Alan Moore with "Watchmen", really seem to have understood the potential of the genre to tap into deep human archetypes and tell a bloody good story.

Being a big fanboy of the Marvel films, I had really high expectations for this film. And for the most part, it did not fail. Infinity War had it all. Comedy, action, emotions and all of my abortive characters for equal screen time. I would’ve like to see more destruction (especially on Earth), and the character didn’t get me super hard because I know most (if not all) of them are coming back. But overall a fantastic and suspenseful film that I think every superhero film fan should watch at least once.

Perhaps the best Avenger's movie. Thanos was so compelling that I forgot how silly he looked. It was surprisingly deep for a big summer blockbuster. I was most amazed that it wasn't a complete disaster.
